intro: Mazus kweichowensis, commonly known as the Kweichow mazus, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
